topic: How to combine hashlib with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine hashlib with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining hashlib and Typing in Python 3.12+ for Production Code
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates the effective use of hashlib and Type Hints in Python 3.12+ to enhance security, maintainability, and readability of production code.
key_points: Using Type Hints with hashlib functions for better type checking and error handling
Defining custom hashing algorithms using generic types
Implementing efficient and secure hashing of user input data
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this example to work
Use of Type Hints (PEP 484) and Hashlib (built-in library)
caveats: Avoid using custom hash functions as password hashes, use a dedicated library like Argon2 or PBKDF2
Always validate input data to ensure it adheres to your application's security policies
